Since its release back in 2023, we’ve only seen a handful of discounts pop up in the last two years, mostly in 2024. While it has gone lower in the past, the 20% markdown still gives you a rare chance at $26 off the going rate, with LEGO also deeming it to be retired in the foreseeable future, so you won’t want to miss out while it’s still around at this price (with rates often jumping up at other marketplaces once sets are retired).

items.title: Tested: Twelve South debuted all-new iPhone 17/Pro/Max cases, but are they any better than a $16 silicone model?
items.summary:
Alongside its new leather BookBook case, Twelve South debuted an all-new collection of silicone iPhone 17/Pro and Pro Max cases with matching Apple Watch bands to match. We have now had a chance to test them out in an attempt to answer the glaring question here – why would anyone pay $50 for a Twelve South silicone case when they can get one that looks similar on Amazon for $16? Let’s dive in.

more…

items.title: Amazon to pay $2.5B in FTC settlement over ‘deceptive’ Prime tactics
items.summary: The company will be required to pay a $1 billion civil penalty and provide $1.5 billion in refunds back to an estimated 35 million consumers harmed by the company's "deceptive Prime enrollment practices," the FTC says.

Not only are all of those deals still live, but some of the new TechWoven models for iPhone 17 Pro and 17 Pro Max have now dropped even lower with Amazon all-time low pricing now live from $52.99 shipped.
